events.title: Execution of Joan of Arc
events.description: Joan of Arc, a French heroine and Roman Catholic saint, was burned at the stake in Rouen, France, after being convicted of heresy.
events.significance: Her death made her a martyr and symbol of French unity and nationalism, leading to her eventual sainthood.

events.title: Death of Vice President Aaron Burr
events.description: Aaron Burr, the third Vice President of the United States, passed away on this day.
events.significance: Burr was a controversial figure in American history, known for his duel with Alexander Hamilton and his complex political legacy.

events.title: First Indianapolis 500 race held
events.description: The inaugural Indianapolis 500, a major automobile race, was held in Speedway, Indiana.
events.significance: The race became one of the most prestigious motor racing events in the world and a significant part of American motorsport history.

events.title: Golden Gate Bridge opens
events.description: The Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco, California, was officially opened to vehicular traffic.
events.significance: At the time, it was the longest and tallest suspension bridge in the world and remains an iconic symbol of American engineering.

events.title: The first successful human heart transplant
events.description: Dr. Christiaan Barnard performed the world's first successful human heart transplant in Cape Town, South Africa.
events.significance: This groundbreaking surgery opened new avenues in medical science and transplant surgery.
